title: Intro to toRvik
text: toRvik package scrapers pull data Barttorvik, popular college basketball analytics website, return tidy format. Barttorvik splits data number variables hosts detailed player game statistics, serving reputable, industry-recognized metric rating system. Generally speaking, data avaliable back 2007-08 season. information Barttorvik, data, metric rating system can found . Package functions syntactically structured point data source (e.g. ‘player,’ ‘game,’ etc.) considered get functions nature. toRvik version 1.0.3, package exports nearly 30 functions covering website data. highlights include: Retrieving detailed game--game player statistics Splitting advanced metrics game location, type, date range, opponent strength Pulling play--play shooting bins players teams Grabbing composite recruit rankings top players coach Generating injury-adjusted efficiency measures team

title: Intro to toRvik
text: toRvik requires set-can instantly executed session. understand package, T-Rank functions, pulling splitting Barttorvik’s metric rating system, excellent place start. title: Intro to toRvik
text: Perhaps valuable functions toRvik concern granular analysis. package gives us ability explore advanced statistics game--game level every Division 1 player since 2007-08 season using bart_player_game. , bart_player_game returned 10 highest individual net BPMs Duke player season. function takes ‘box,’ ‘shooting,’ ‘advanced’ stat inputs, welcome explore one session. want investigate similar performance season level? Well, bart_player_season gives us option – also taking ‘box,’ ‘shooting,’ ‘advanced’ stat inputs. now, tibble season-long shooting data Duke players, sorted number mid-range attempts. Advanced metric data can pulled team per-game basis using bart_team_schedule, total team shooting splits can accessed using bart_team_shooting. Game box data can pulled bart_game_total.

title: Intro to toRvik
text: Lastly introductory vignette, explore toRvik functions scraping tournament data. Frequent time social media college basketball circles March, undoubtedly hear ‘team sheets,’ detailed repositories strength quality metrics used seeding selection committee. bart_tourney_sheets, can pull ‘quick-hit’ team sheets tidy format just single line code: Returned sheets top teams sorted NCAA NET ranking. function relies NET data, available back 2018-19 season. -season performance valuable, want investigate just tournament data? Well, toRvik gives two options : bart_tourney_odds bart_tourney_results. former returns metric-adjusted round probabilities split. Let’s explore round odds 2022 NCAA Tournament: ‘odds’ argument set ‘pre,’ returned pre-tournament odds sorted likelihood reach second weekend (Sweet 16). bart_tourney_odds also takes current odds (‘current’), odds based recent performance (‘recent’), odds based games strong opponents (‘t100’). data similarly available starting 2019 tournament. Now, want explore tournament results? bart_tourney_results, can return raw adjusted outcomes split. , returned aggregate conference results 2011 2021, sorted PAKE – number wins attained KenPom expectation. function splits team (‘team’), conference (‘conf’), coach (‘coach’), seed (‘seed’) includes data starting 2000.
code: tictoc::tic() toRvik::bart_tourney_sheets(year=2022) %>%   utils::head(10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 16 #>    team     seed   net   kpi   sor res_avg   bpi    kp   sag qual_…¹ q1a   q1    #>    <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <chr> <chr> #>  1 Gonzaga     1     1     5     7     6       1     1     1     1   5-2   10-3  #>  2 Arizona     1     2     3     2     2.5     3     2     2     2.3 4-2   6-3   #>  3 Houston     5     3    13    14    13.5     2     4     5     3.7 0-3   1-4   #>  4 Baylor      1     4     2     4     3       6     5     4     5   4-4   10-5  #>  5 Kentuc…     2     5     9     5     7       4     3     6     4.3 3-6   9-7   #>  6 Kansas      1     6     1     1     1       8     6     3     5.7 4-4   12-5  #>  7 Tennes…     3     7     4     3     3.5     5     7     7     6.3 4-7   11-7  #>  8 Villan…     2     8     7     8     7.5     7    11     9     9   5-4   7-6   #>  9 Texas …     3     9    17    12    14.5    13     9    14    12   5-5   8-9   #> 10 UCLA        4    10    11    15    13       9     8    10     9   2-4   5-4   #> # title: toRvik
text: toRvik R package working scraping men’s college basketball. lot college basketball data , difficult pull clean behind paywall. toRvik, immediate access detailed extensive college basketball statistics publicly available – returned tidy format just single line code! Best , subscription required access data. toRvik’s functions powered dedicated Fast API framework – delivering data rapid speeds dependable -times. version 1.0.3, package includes nearly 30 functions pulling player team data, game results, advanced metric splits, play--play shooting, . Leveraging data models Barttorvik, package now offers game tournament predictor functions, allowing simulate games pair teams date venue back 2014-15 season. toRvik also offers extensive transfer histories 5,000 players back 2011-12 season detailed player recruiting rankings 6,000 players back 2007-08.

title: toRvik
text: Calling bart_game_predictions returns expected points, possessions, win percentage given game given date. simulate North Carolina Duke mid-January: Calling bart_tournament_prediction simulate single-elimination tournament group teams given date. simulate 2022 Final Four 25 times:
code: bart_game_prediction('Duke', 'North Carolina', '20220113', location = 'H') ## ── Duke vs. North Carolina Prediction ────────────────────────── toRvik 1.1.0 ──  ## ℹ Data updated: 2022-09-08 21:16:54 EDT  ## # A tibble: 2 × 8 ##   team           date          location tempo   ppp   pts win_per did_win ##   <chr>          <chr>         <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <lgl>   ## 1 Duke           Jan. 13, 2022 Home      73.4  1.15  84.2    73.1 TRUE    ## 2 North Carolina Jan. 13, 2022 Away      73.4  1.02  75.1    26.9 FALSE bart_tournament_prediction(teams = c('Duke', 'North Carolina', 'Kansas', 'Villanova'), '20220402', sims = 25, seed = 10) ## ── Tournament Prediction: 25 Sims ────────────────────────────── toRvik 1.1.0 ──  ## ℹ Data updated: 2022-09-08 21:16:55 EDT  ## # A tibble: 4 × 4 ##   team            wins finals champ ##   <chr>          <int>  <int> <int> ## 1 Duke              31     21    10 ## 2 Kansas            17     10     7 ## 3 Villanova         21     15     6 ## 4 North Carolina     6      4     2

title: Get Conference Four Factor Statistics — bart_conf_factors
text: year Filters year (YYYY) conf Filters conference opp_conf Filters opponent conference type Filters game type ('nc', 'conf', 'post') location Filters game location ('H', '', 'N') start Filters starting date (YYYY-MM-DD) end Filters ending date (YYYY-MM-DD)

title: Get Conference Four Factor Statistics — bart_conf_factors
text: Returns tibble 21 columns: conf character. rating double. Expected scoring margin average   team neutral court. rank double. adj_o double. adj_o_rank double. adj_d double. adj_d_rank double. tempo double. off_ppp double. Raw points scored per possession. off_efg double. Team effective FG%. off_to double. Offensive turnover rate. off_or double. Offensive rebound rate. off_ftr double. Offensive free throw rate. def_ppp double. Raw points allowed per possession. def_efg double. Effective FG% allowed. def_to double. Turnover rate forced. def_or double. Defensive rebound rate. def_ftr double. Free throw rate allowed. wins integer. losses integer. games integer.

title: Get Conference Four Factor Statistics — bart_conf_factors
text: brief explanation factor computation, please visit KenPom's blog. Data can split five variables: venue Splits game location; '', 'home', 'away', 'neutral', 'road' (away + neutral). type Splits game type; '', 'nc' (non-conference), 'conf' (conference), 'reg' (regular season), 'post' (post-season tournaments), 'ncaa' (NCAA tournament). quad Splits quadrant level; 1-4 0 indicating 1-games. top Splits opponent T-Rank position, adjusted game location. start/end Splits date range (YYYYMMDD).

title: Get Conference Four Factor Statistics — bart_conf_factors

title: torvik 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-09

title: torvik 1.1.0
text: Code Updates: Improved data retrieval speeds shifting many functions wrapping dedicated Fast API Added transfer_portal, player_recruiting_rankings, bart_game_prediction, bart_tournament_prediction Removed bart_transfers, bart_pro, bart_team_schedule : Added headers data pulled API note time retrieved

title: toRvik 1.0.3
text: Patches: Fixed data issue caused bart_player_season fail row binds across certain seasons Code Updates: Added bart_pro pull statistics draft-eligible players : Moved package site self-host AWS

title: toRvik 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-04-22

title: toRvik 1.0.2
text: Addressed CRAN submission comments: Omitted ‘Functions’ package title Provided links utilized web services DESCRIPTION Changed logical variables package-wide ‘T’ ‘F’ ‘TRUE’ ‘FALSE’ Added \values{} field function documentation Code Updates: Added support pulling complete player statistics setting stat argument ‘’ bart_player_season, bart_player_game, bart_transfers (new default) Transitioned using switch() lookup values several functions Moved examples >5s run time \donttest{} keep output present site passing CRAN checks Added WAB (wins bubble) column bart_factors keep consistent output analogous bart_conf_factors Switched neutral variable bart_season_schedule logical type : Site refresh CRAN release

title: toRvik 1.0.1
text: Initial CRAN submission rejected; fixed 1.0.2 Patches: Fixed package-breaking user agent issue threw HTTP 403 error Windows machines using withr Fixed function-breaking file issue caused bart_player_game fail Code Updates: Added bart_team_box return team box statistics per-game averages Added argument filter bart_transfers active portal players committed ones : Changed pkgdown site colors

title: toRvik 1.0.0
text: Initial release. detailed list changes toRvik, consult commit history https://github.com/andreweatherman/toRvik
